qa_pairs.question: ethereum dominance
qa_pairs.answer: Ethereum Dominance Definition: Ethereum dominance refers to the percentage of the overall cryptocurrency market capitalization that Ethereum (ETH) accounts for. It is a metric used to measure the relative strength and influence of Ethereum compared to the rest of the cryptocurrency market. Key points about Ethereum dominance: 1. Calculation: - Ethereum dominance is calculated by dividing Ethereum's market capitalization by the total cryptocurrency market capitalization and expressing it as a percentage. - Ethereum dominance = Ethereum's market cap / Total cryptocurrency market cap x 100 2. Significance: - Ethereum dominance is an important indicator of Ethereum's position and influence in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. - A higher Ethereum dominance suggests Ethereum is a more significant and influential player in the crypto market. - Ethereum dominance is often compared to Bitcoin dominance, which measures Bitcoin's market share. 3. Historical Trends: - Ethereum dominance has fluctuated over time as the cryptocurrency market has evolved. - In 2016, Ethereum's dominance was around 10% of the total crypto market cap. - Ethereum's dominance peaked in 2018 at around 32% as the platform gained traction for its smart contract functionality and decentralized applications (dApps). - As of March 2023, Ethereum's dominance is around 18% of the total cryptocurrency market capitalization. 4. Factors Influencing Ethereum Dominance: - Ethereum's technological developments, such as upgrades and improvements to the network. - The growth and adoption of Ethereum-based applications and the overall Ethereum ecosystem. - Competition from other blockchain platforms and cryptocurrencies. - Regulatory changes and market sentiment surrounding Ethereum and the crypto industry. 5. Uses and Implications: - Ethereum dominance is closely monitored by investors, analysts, and the broader cryptocurrency community. - It provides insights into the relative strength and market position of Ethereum compared to other cryptocurrencies. - Changes in Ethereum dominance can signal shifts in the crypto market and investor sentiment towards Ethereum. Sources: - CoinMarketCap: https://coinmarketcap.com/ - Ethereum.org: https://ethereum.org/en/ - Investopedia: https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/ethereum-dominance.asp - CoinDesk: https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2023/03/16/ethereums-dominance-of-crypto-market-falls-to-18-lowest-since-2018/
